member.name: M:Weavy.Core.Models.PropertyDictionary.IsTypeSupported(System.Type)
member.summary:
Checks if instances of the specified type can be stored in the dictionary. The following types are supported:
enum byte, short int long bool double float string Guid DateTime TimeSpan IEntity. Entity. Entity<T>.
Nullables, IList<> and List<> of the types are also supported, e.g. int?, IList<IEntity> and List<DateTime?>.
member.param: The type to check.
member.returns: true if the type is a valid, otherwise false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the depth of the search (only when and/or is specified). member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Models.ConversationQuery.UserId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the conversation member, default is the id of the current user, null returns all conversations.

member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Models.ConversationQuery.SearchEmpty
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether empty conversations should be included. true returns only empty conversations, false returns only conversations with messages and null returns all conversations. Default is null.

member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Models.ConversationQuery.SearchRead
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether already read conversations should be included. true returns only read conversations, false returns only unread conversations and null returns all conversations. Default is null.

member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Models.ConversationQuery.SearchArchived
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating wheather to return archived conversations. true returns only archived conversations, false returns only non-archived conversations and null ignores the archived field. Default is null.

member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Models.ConversationQuery.SearchNotified
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to find conversations where the user has been notified via email about new messages. true returns only conversations where the user has been notified via email, false returns only conversations where the user has not been notified via email, and null returns all conversations. Default is null.

member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Models.ConversationQuery.SearchRooms
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to find chat rooms. true returns only rooms, false returns only one-on-one conversations and null returns all conversations. Default is null.

member.name: T:Weavy.Core.Cron.CrontabSchedule
member.summary: Represents a schedule initialized from the crontab expression.
member.example:
Crontab expression format:
* * * * * - - - - - | | | | | | | | | +----- day of week (0 - 6) (Sunday=0) | | | +------- month (1 - 12) | | +--------- day of month (1 - 31) | +----------- hour (0 - 23) +------------- min (0 - 59)
Star (*) in the value field above means all legal values as in braces for that column. The value column can have a * or a list of elements separated by commas. An element is either a number in the ranges shown above or two numbers in the range separated by a hyphen (meaning an inclusive range).
Source: http://www.adminschoice.com/docs/crontab.htm

member.name: M:Weavy.Core.Cron.CrontabSchedule.GetNextOccurrences(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Enumerates all the occurrences of this schedule starting with a base time and up to an end time limit. This method uses deferred execution such that the occurrences are only calculated as they are enumerated.
member.remarks: This method does not return the value of itself if it falls on the schedule. For example, if is midnight and the schedule was created from the expression * * * * * (meaning every minute) then the next occurrence of the schedule will be at one minute past midnight and not midnight itself. The method returns the next occurrence after . Also, is exclusive.

member.name: M:Weavy.Core.Cron.CrontabSchedule.GetNextOccurrence(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the next occurrence of this schedule starting with a base time.

member.name: M:Weavy.Core.Cron.CrontabSchedule.GetNextOccurrence(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the next occurrence of this schedule starting with a base time and up to an end time limit.
member.remarks: This method does not return the value of itself if it falls on the schedule. For example, if is midnight and the schedule was created from the expression * * * * * (meaning every minute) then the next occurrence of the schedule will be at one minute past midnight and not midnight itself. The method returns the next occurrence after . Also, is exclusive.

The constraint mode, determines how to resolve aspect ratio differences between the requested size and the original file dimensions.

member.summary: Returns an url to a thumbnail image for the specified blob.
member.param: The blob for which to return a thumbnail url.
The width constraint.
The height constraint.
If true, the thumbnail image is created with 2x resolution.
The constraint mode, determines how to resolve aspect ratio differences between the requested size and the original image's size.
Controls whether the image is allowed to upscale, downscale, both, or if only the canvas gets to be upscaled.
How to align the image when padding or cropping.
The background color to apply (null for transparency), white will be used for jpg images when background is unspecified.
The encoding quality to use (only applies to jpg images).
If true, the ICC profile of the image will be ignored.
true to generate an absolute url, otherwise false
true to add a cache busting query string parameter, otherwise false

member.summary: How to resolve aspect ratio differences between the requested size and the original image's size.

member.name: F:Weavy.Core.Imaging.FitMode.Fit
member.summary: The image is resized to fit in the destination dimensions while it preserves its native aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Weavy.Core.Imaging.FitMode.Pad
member.summary: The image is resized to fill the destination dimensions, padding is used if there is an aspect ratio difference.

member.name: F:Weavy.Core.Imaging.FitMode.Crop
member.summary: The image is resized to fill the destination dimensions, cropping is used if there is an aspect ratio difference.

member.name: F:Weavy.Core.Imaging.FitMode.Stretch
member.summary: The image is resized to fill the destination dimensions., the image is stretched if there is an aspect ratio difference.

member.summary: Instructs ResizeJob to preserve the target bitmap (will cause mem leak unless disposed externally)

member.summary: When a filename is specified, instructs ResizeJob to create any needed parent folder levels

member.name: F:Weavy.Core.Imaging.JobOptions.BufferEntireSourceStream
member.summary: The source stream will be copied into a memory-based stream so the original stream can be closed earlier. Required if you are writing to the same file you are reading from.

member.name: T:Weavy.Core.Imaging.Quantizer
member.summary: Abstract Quantizer class - handles the messy, algorithm-independent details of quantization. Subclasses must implement InitialQuantizePixel, GetPallete(), and QuantizePixel. Not thread-safe!

member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Imaging.Quantizer.FixedPalette
member.summary: (Readonly) If true, the algorithm can do everything in QuantizePixel, and InitialQuantizePixel will not be called. Implies ResizeForFirstPass=False and FourPass=false=

member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Imaging.Quantizer.PixelSize
member.summary: The number of bytes in a ARGB structure. Should be 4

member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Imaging.Quantizer.FullTrust
member.summary: If true, pointer arithmetic will be used instead of GetPixel. GetPixel is much slower. If false, OmitFinalStage will be assumed true, as only palette generation is possible in low trust. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Imaging.Quantizer.ResizeForFirstPass
member.summary: If true, the first pass (InitialQuantizePixel) will be performed on a size-limited version of the original image to control performance. Ignored if FixedPalette=True

member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Imaging.Quantizer.FirstPassPixelCount
member.summary: The approximate number of pixels to use when making a scaled copy of the image for the first pass. Only used when ResizeForFirstPass=True and FirstPassPixelThreshold is exceeded.

member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Imaging.Quantizer.FirstPassPixelThreshold
member.summary: The maximum number of pixels the original image may contain before a scaled copy is made for the first pass. Only relevant when ResizeForFirstPass=True

member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Imaging.Quantizer.FourPass
member.summary: If true, image is re-paletted after quantization - forces 2 clones of the original image to be created. FixedPalette and OmitFinalStage should be false if this is used.

member.name: P:Weavy.Core.Imaging.Quantizer.OmitFinalStage
member.summary: If true, a 32-bit image with an 8-bit palette will be returned instead of an 8-bit image, which GDI can save using median-cut quantization. Much faster than our final quantization pass, although it can't do transparency. Assumed true if FullTrust is false.

member.name: M:Weavy.Core.Imaging.Quantizer.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct the quantizer
member.param: If true, the quantization only needs to loop through the source pixels once - InitialQuantiize
member.remarks: If you construct this class with a true value for singlePass, then the code will, when quantizing your image, only call the 'QuantizeImage' function. If two passes are required, the code will call 'InitialQuantizeImage' and then 'QuantizeImage'.

member.name: M:Weavy.Core.Imaging.Quantizer.Reset
member.summary: Resets the quantizer so it can process a new image.

member.param: The image to quantize
member.returns: A quantized version of the image

member.name: T:Weavy.Core.Imaging.Shade
member.summary: Enum for color tones.
member.remarks: . Calculated using Cubic Spline http://www.akiti.ca/CubicSpline.html using known data 0=9, 50=55, 100=99 from 8 equal pieces 0 to 100 (each 12.5%) This means black (0%) should be 9% (#171717) and white (100%) should be 99% (#fcfcfc). One extra dark 1/4 piece more than black (0% + 12.5%/4 = 3.125%) for panels and texts etc. One extra light 1/4 piece less than white (100% - 12.5%/4 = 96.875%) for panels and texts etc.
